{{nihongo|'''Daisuke Sakata'''|åç° å¤§è¼|Sakata Daisuke|born January 16, 1983 in [[KÅnan-ku, Yokohama]], [[Japan]]}} is a [[Japanese people|Japanese]] [[football (soccer)]] player who currently playing for [[F.C. Tokyo]] in the [[J. League]]. He is an agile forward and can use both feet.
==Career== He first played for [[Yokohama FlÃ¼gels]] youth team but became a [[Yokohama F. Marinos]] youth player when both teams merged in 1999. He was promoted to the top team in 2001. His first league appearance came on June 16, 2001 in a 0-2 defeat by [[F.C. Tokyo]] at the [[International Stadium Yokohama]]. His first league goal came on August 18, 2001 when he scored the lone goal against [[Kashiwa Reysol]] at [[Kashiwa no Ha Park Stadium]].
He was a member of the Japan team for the 2002 [[AFC Youth Championship]] in [[Qatar]]. The team finished runners-up and was qualified for the [[2003 FIFA World Youth Championship]]
At the World Youth Championship hosted by [[United Arab Emirates]], he scored 4 goals in the tournament including the winner against [[England national football team|England]] at the group stage and became one of the top scorers along with [[Fernando Cavenaghi]] (Argentine), [[Dudu]] (Brazil) and [[Eddie Johnson (American soccer)|Eddie Johnson]] (U.S.A.). The team exited at the quarter final stage after beaten by Brazil.
He made his full international debut for [[Japan national football team|Japan]] on August 9, 2006 in a friendly against [[Trinidad and Tobago national football team|Trinidad and Tobago]] at the [[Olympic Stadium (Tokyo)|National Olympic Stadium]] in [[Tokyo]] when he replaced [[Alessandro dos Santos|Alex]] in the 86th minute.
Sakata joined Greek Superleage side [[Aris FC]] in 2011 after ten years at [[Yokohama F. Marinos]].
